alert.note: Alert for Onondaga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 2:13PM EDT until July 07 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following county, Onondaga. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 212 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated up to an inch of heavy rain has fallen due to a thunderstorm. Rain is ending, but urban and small stream flooding will continue from the earlier heavy rain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Syracuse, Manlius, Lyndon, De Witt, Fayetteville, Minoa, East Syracuse, Clark Reservation State Park, Jamesville, Nedrow and Onondaga. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
